section.name: Welcome to Wicket Stuff
section.p: The Wicket Stuff project provides additional Java web components to the core components supplied by the Wicket framework. Components offered by this project include:
Wicket is a Java web application framework that takes simplicity, separation of concerns and ease of development to a whole new level.

The Wicket Stuff project provides non-core components to the Wicket project. By non-core we mean that the Wicket project should focus on being a very focussed framework, not distracted by development of other frameworks, such as Hibernate or Spring . This enables the core developers to focus on creating a first class framework, and the other developers to create many components, that the core couldn't foresee to maintain.

section.name: Latest News

subsection.name: Juli 17, 2005 - Wicket 1.0.1 available for download
subsection.p: The Wicket development team has made the first maintenance release of the Wicket 1.0 project available: Wicket 1.0.1 is now available for download. A new release of the Kickstart project has also been made available to kickstart your bug free Wicket development.

subsection.name: June 7, 2005 - Wicket 1.0 available for download
subsection.p: The Wicket development team has made the 1.0 final release available for immediate download. This release marks a huge milestone in the development cycle of Wicket. Go to the downloads page to download Wicket 1.0!
We are preparing a media campaign for Wicket 1.0. So you may find us in the media soon. Keep an eye out for Wicket!

subsection.name: April 17, 2005 - Kick Start Your Wicket Development!
subsection.p: The Kick Start project gives you a head start when you want to begin your own Wicket web application. We currently only kick start you in Eclipse, but NetBeans and IntelliJ support will arrive in the near future.

subsection.name: March 22, 2005 - Wicket Stuff was accepted by SourceForge
subsection.p: The Wicket team wishes to thank the SourceForge team for accepting Wicket Stuff as a project on the SourceForge servers. This allows Wicket to grow further beyond our dreams.

section.p: See the news archive for more (older) news.

section.name: Special Thanks
section.p: The Wicket Stuff development team would like to thank the following partners for supporting Open Source in general and Wicket in particular.
